text: in the last few minutes another barrel
bomb perhaps to have been dropped on
this neighborhood you can already see
the incredible amount of damage has been
done by effectively months of
bombardment in civilian areas many these
buildings are now unoccupied because of
course people have left the area tens of
thousands of people are thought to have
fled Aleppo over the last few months in
a campaign a relentless bombing by the
government in particular the use of what
they call barrel bombs these are
effectively oil drums packed with
explosives shards of metal they're
dropped from helicopters and they're
pretty indiscriminate most of the people
who live in these areas have now fled
whole neighborhoods are effectively
abandoned every now and again you see
the odd person running down the road
sometimes small children going through
rubbish but otherwise people have
effectively run to the countryside for
safety the Syrian government insists
that when it drops these bombs is
targeting rebel positions attacking
those who have chosen to try and take
over the country what he calls
terrorists we human rights organizations
have said these devices are completely
indiscriminate they're dropped out of
helicopters they tumble to the ground
and there's no way of guaranteeing where
they land we spent the last few days
inside the city and what you're struck
by is the fact that the bombing campaign
pretty much doesn't stop day and night
and the truth is that there's almost
nowhere in Aleppo that could be
described as safe either on the
government side and certainly not on the
opposition side
